intro: Sabia yunnanensis subsp. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved sabia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies in its native range.
